DOC.brief_summary: Background : The number multiple pregnancy consider important adverse effect vitro fertilisation ( IVF ) intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) . IVF ICSI transfer one embryo , elective single embryo transfer ( eSET ) , reduce incidence remarkably . Unfortunately , former research document cycle SET maintain low pregnancy rate compare double embryo transfer ( DET ) . Implementation eSET require carefully choose thoroughly define implementation strategy focus couple undergoing subfertility treatment . This trial investigate ( cost ) effectiveness combine patient centre implementation strategy . Objective : The main aim compare effectiveness cost implementation elective single embryo transfer ( eSET ) vitro fertilisation ( IVF ) intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) , usual care combine patient-centred strategy . Study design : A randomised control trial Study population : Couples female age le 40 year ongoing IVF/ICSI treatment 2 13 Dutch IVF centre 4 satellite/transport centre . Intervention A combined patient centre implementation strategy eSET IVF/ICSI . The strategy consist counsel evidence base decision aid reimbursement 4th cycle couple choose eSET first 2 cycle . Primary study parameters/outcome study : eSET occurrence rate , pregnancy outcomes cost-effectiveness combined strategy . Secondary study parameters/outcome study : - patient knowledge - patient decisional conflict - patient satisfaction - IVF/ICSI treatment outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Patient-Centered Implementation Trial Single Embryo Transfer
DOC.criteria: Female age < 39 year In first cycle minimum two embryo available transfer Medical necessity single embryo transfer
